Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert tourist guide. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to generate an itinerary for your tour.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a itinerary using the questions and answers above.

QApair.Question: What are your tour goals?
QApair.Answer: My tour goals are to see the sights, learn about the culture and do some adventurous activities with my friends.

QApair.Question: What are your preferred tour activities?
QApair.Answer: My preferred tour activities would be to visit historical places, party with my friends, and go on some adventures and probably on a hike too.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred tour pace?
QApair.Answer: My preferred tour pace would be to take it slow and steady so we can enjoy everything the place has to offer without feeling rushed. I also wouldnt want to miss any places by spending a lot of time at one place.

QApair.Question: What is your ideal tour group size?
QApair.Answer: I am travelling with my family and we are a group of four.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred tour duration?
QApair.Answer: I would prefer a tour duration of around 15 days so that we can cover most of the places without feeling too rushed.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred tour time of year?
QApair.Answer: I would prefer a tour during the winter months in India so that we can enjoy the weather as it wouldn�t be very harsh and its suitable for travel.

QApair.Question: What is your preferred tour budget?
QApair.Answer: I would prefer a tour budget of around Rs. 30000/- per person so that we can have a comfortable tour without spending too much and also can make most of it.

QApair.Question: What are your preferred tour accommodations?
QApair.Answer: My preferred tour accommodations would be a 3 star hotel with all the basic amenities like a swimming pool, spa, gym, etc. Also, I would prefer if it has a jacuzzi.

QApair.Question: What are your other preferred tour amenities?
QApair.Answer: My other preferred tour amenities would be a tour guide who is knowledgeable about the places we are visiting and can give us a lot of information about the culture and history. Also, I would prefer if the tour guide is friendly and can take us to some hidden places which are not very famous but are worth visiting. I would also prefer local food so I would like to visit the local restaurants and also local handlooms or shops for some shopping.

QApair.Question: What are your dietary restrictions?
QApair.Answer: I don�t have any restrictions and I�m open to try all the local dishes.

QApair.Question: What are your tour transportation preferences?
QApair.Answer: I would prefer a car with a driver who can take us places without hassle.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other preferences or requirements that we should know about?
QApair.Answer: Yes we would need extra baggage space.

QApair.Question: Do you have any questions for us?
QApair.Answer: No, Im good.

Instances.Output:
Day 1: Arrive in India and check into the hotel. Relax and take a dip in the pool.Day 2: Wake up early and explore the historical places in the city. In the evening, party with your friends in the hotel.Day 3: Today, go on an adventure hike with your friends.Day 4: Visit the local shops and handlooms to do some shopping. In the evening, try the local cuisine in the restaurants.Day 5: Today, visit the hidden places which are not very famous but are worth visiting.Day 6: Relax in the hotel and take some time to enjoy the amenities.Day 7: Wake up early and explore the city some more.Day 8: Today, visit the historical places and learn about the culture.


Day 9: Today, go on an adventure hike with your friends.


Day 10: Visit the local shops and handlooms to do some shopping. In the evening, try the local cuisine in the restaurants.


Day 11: Today, visit the hidden places which are not very famous but are worth visiting.


Day 12: Relax in the hotel and take some time to enjoy the amenities.

Instances.Output:
Day 1:


- Arrive at the airport and meet your tour guide.
- Take a bus/train/taxi to your hotel.
- Check into the hotel and relax for a bit.
- In the evening, head out to explore the nightlife in the city.
- Visit some bars and clubs and have a great time!


Day 2:


- After breakfast, head out for a day of exploring the city.
- Visit some of the famous tourist spots and learn about the history and culture.
- In the evening, head to a local restaurant for dinner and try some delicious food.
- Spend the rest of the night stargazing or hiking.


Day 3:


- Today, head out for a day of hiking and camping.
- Explore the beautiful nature and take in the fresh air.
- Spend the night camping under the stars.


Day 4:


- After breakfast, head out for a day of shopping.
- Visit some local handlooms and shops and buy some souvenirs.
- In the evening, head back to the hotel and relax.

Instances.Output:
Day 1:
- Arrive in Chennai and check into your hotel
- In the afternoon, visit the Kapaleeshwarar Temple and the Parthasarathy Temple
- In the evening, stroll along Marina Beach


Day 2:
- Drive to Pondicherry and visit Auroville, the Sri Aurobindo Ashram, and the Manakula Vinayagar Temple
- In the evening, walk around the French Colony


Day 3:
- Drive to Tiruvannamalai and visit the Annamalaiyar Temple
- In the afternoon, hike up Arunachala Hill
- In the evening, attend the Girivalam procession


Day 4:
- Drive to Kanchipuram and visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, the Kamakshi Amman Temple, and the Varadaraja Temple
- In the evening, browse the silk shops


Day 5:
- Drive back to Chennai and visit the Sri Vadapalani Andavar Temple
- In the afternoon, visit the Chennai Museum
- In the evening, enjoy a traditional Tamil meal
